reviewText: Ellen: The Complete Season One might as well be considered completely seperate from the rest of the series.  When the first season originally aired, it was titled 'These Friends of Mine' and was much more Seinfeldish than it grew to be by the second, and especially third seasons.  In the first season, Ellen has not come out of the closet yet (that is still 3 seasons away).  It is kind of weird seeing her dating men, as you can totally see there is no chemistry there at all.  Also, later series regulars Joely Fisher and Jeremy Piven have not yet joined the cast.  There are two other female friends featured here that are inexplicably gone by the end of these 13 episodes and never return.  Joely Fisher is then first introduced in the first episode of Season 2 with no explanation as well.With that being said, even though there are major differences between this first season and the rest of the series, it is still a great, funny show.  Ellen truly is a comedic genius and she works well with this first season cast (though I must say she has much better chemistry with the later casts).  Amazon Marketplace has this set for sale pretty cheap; it's definitely worth a look, whether you are a current Ellen fan, or new to the series.  The DVDs do not have many special features; there is a commentary or two (with Ellen herself conspicuously absent) and some biographies and that's about it.  But you do get 13 pretty darn funny episodes!  Highly recommended!
summary: Excellent start to an excellent series!

reviewText: I remember this show being a lot funnier than it is. I think Ellen Degeneres is the funniest person on the planet, but this sitcom has only moments of her "funnyness." This show reminds me SO MUCH of Three's Company, where the entire "dilemma" in each episode can be resolved by one character simply telling the truth. It actually gets annoying sometimes. There's only one John Ritter, so that kind of comedy doesn't bother me when I'm watching Joyce DeWitt and John Ritter. But it just didn't seem to work here. Just my opinion.For what it is though, it is funny and entertaining. Would I have bought it knowing what I know now? No.Again, just my opinion. :)

reviewText: I enjoy this show. The adorable Adam and Page are what make this show so good, and Jeremy Piven does not comeonto the show untill later.. Maybe season two is better, as this is when these characters arrive with the actors we know. .Page is played best by Joely Fischer.. the Desperate Housewives star. .Ari Gross is unreplaceable.. Ellen is also not replaceable, and what a powerful and wonderful person. The shenanigans of these actors make this a classic. No hardcore issues at this point with Lesbianism and whatnot. Easy to watch with your mom. Ellen will always be a genius and the beloved "Lucy" of "I love Lucy" is evoked for inspiration for this series. Ellen will always cheer me up, Vanes

reviewText: Marlens and Black created the sit-com "Ellen" in 1990 starin g the gifted ellen DeGeneres. It became famous (and historical) because it was the first TV show where the central character came out and decalred her homosexuality on screen. Ellen became an importyant part of television histyory, paving the way for "Will & Grace" and "Modern Family" but that's not what this review is about.As with any series (with the possible esception of "fasier") this series began with a rocky start. In fact, tyhe chacraters and writingh eeally didn;ty fall into place until halfway through season one. Season one was a "fast jobv" network mid-year5 pick up and it took some time for the producers and writers to see what it is that Ellen is capoable of doing. They shifted from the script wored for word to allowing the camera to roll as Degeneres would improvise one of her now famous rambles. This season includes the spectacular t4easer in which Ellen puyts the jug of water on the cooler in her kitchen , spilling gallons of water everywhere and, when it was done3, settlped back and sai8d, "There. That's done." The scripts began edging toward farce and where none of them hit Feydeau, the cast stayed in character as Ellen took ordinary situations and made them funny as hell. By tyhe end of season one it's clear that this was a find as remarkable as Lucille Ball andMary Tyler Moore.The supporting cast is fgine here and where most of them were replaced for the se4cond season I am not certain this was a wise choice. Maggie Wheeler was a better "Paige" character than Paige was, but in the same token she;d have been forgotten here and then Marta Kaufman ansd David Crane would never hjave put her on ":Friends" as the remarkable and nev er to be forgotten Janice. It's nice to see this beautiful woman use her real voice, her real comedic ckills in a subtle way and her character has developed beautifully by the end of the season. Audrey is introduced in this season as a married negatyive irritant whom Ellen dislikes and then reapperas in season two as the single, pink encrusted multyi-milliopnaire that we grew to love. Ayre GRossis remarkable from day one and indeed one of the sad points of the show was his decisiopn to leave. (Jeremy Priven made a damned good replacement bringing a new dynamic)Season one focuses a great deal on Ellen and dating (indeed, one suitor calls her from the toilet ruining any cyance of her ever seeing him again.) Ass time went by it became clkear that not only was the actress tyired of being closetetd but she'd be damned if her character would also. But all things have a start and season one of Ellen, though not as weak as season five, is a good start. The brilliance of this show falls in seasons two through four buty one and five work as nice bookwends. If you;ve limited money, skip this season and buy the others, but in truth, there is a great deal of above average comedy and writing on this disc. And Degeneres made sacrificesw for mankind. For that alone, we all need to be aware. The laughs are simply a bonus.
summary: A bumpt start but brilliance by episode six

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of Ellen, but I had never seen any of the sitcom until I bought this DVD.  It was well worth it.  I love Ellen's sense of humor--it's extremely positive.  I also like how she's still true to her sexuality in this season, even though she's playing a straight woman.  With all of her potential boyfriends, then something goes wrong.  And, again, I really like how positive her sense of humor is.  Ellen makes people happy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watched this show religiously for the first 3 years.  Then when she announced being a lesbian in season four, I, as a gay man, said "Ok, Ellen, we get it...you're a lesbian...enough already."  Sorry, but seasons one through three are gems.  Seasons four and five, she lost it.  The charm was gone.  It was hammer time with lesbian this and lesbian that.  I know it was a milestone in TV history.  I will give her credit for that and Ellen, I love you for that.  But did you have to embarrass us, your gay fans, every week during season four and five with the constant reminder?  I liked the first three seasons.  They were beautifully written and very funny.  Seasons four and five could have been funny if we were not bombarded with the constant reminder of sexual preference.  But this season, season one, yes, get it and laugh...a lot!!!

reviewText: This is the first season from Ellen's t.v. sitcom, appropriately named, "Ellen."  As a teenager, I was a huge fan of the show - which started out as "These Friends of Mine" but was later renamed "Ellen."  The first season features Ellen with friends Adam, Nina, and Holly - the only character who moves into the second season is Adam (played by Arye Gross).  I liked this season because of the dynamic between the four cast members...very funny...typical 90's sitcom humor (If Seinfeld and Friends had a love child, this would be it).  The series itself was on for 5 seasons, but this first one is classic - Ellen's natural born sense of humor is evident in each episode...it's Ellen!
summary: 'These Friends of Mine' - Who doesn't LOVE Ellen?

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of Ellen! I never miss her day time talk show. I never new she had a sitcom...until it came on tv one day. I couldn't stop watching. Immediately I fell in love with the show. It will have you laughing the whole time. The first couple season have different characters in them and at first I didn't like them, but once you give them a chance you will. Each season gets better.The first season has some great episodes in them. Like I said, they get better with each season. By the third season... you'll be laughing until your stomach hurts.I bought this used only because all of the seasons are really expensive!!! I will someday bite the bullet and buy them all. I love the show that much and it stopped playing on cable tv.With that said... I bought mine used from HASTINGS. The shipping was crazy fast and the box wasn't that tore up. When I looked to see if the cd's had scratches... they didn't, not one. When I went to play the dvd's, the picture was blurry in spots and where the straight lines were there were zig zags. I think that when HASTINGS cleaned it... it messed with the picture. I didn't pay too much for it but when you get something you want it to play good. :( I usually always order from HASTINGS but Idk about that anymore.
